DaD.loader

Class ItemLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • DaD.loader.ItemLoader

  • public class ItemLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Clovis on 29/05/2017. Singleton used to load the races information out of the race configuration file.
    See Also:
    ItemTemplate, DaD.loader

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final ItemLoader getInstance()
        Accessor for private instance of class.
        Returns:
        ItemLoader

      • loadItems

        public void loadItems()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Loading function that browse configuration file to find node containing ItemTemplate information.

        Depending on the type of items we will call encode Goods or encode Gear.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an item with an ID that already exists is loaded.

      • displayItemsStats

        private void displayItemsStats(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> itemStat)
        Display all stats of an item template from the given HashMap.
        Parameters:
        itemStat - HashMap containing all stats of the item.

      • encodeGear

        private void encodeGear(org.w3c.dom.Node actualNode)
        Function called by loadItems to create a weapon from the retrieved information in the configuration file.
        Parameters:
        actualNode - Node of the XML file where the weapon information start.
        See Also:
        ItemTemplate

      • encodeGoods

        private void encodeGoods(org.w3c.dom.Node actualNode)
        Function called by loadItems to create a armor from the retrieved information in the configuration file.
        Parameters:
        actualNode - Node of the XML file where the armor information start.
        See Also:
        ItemTemplate

      • encodeEnv

        private Env encodeEnv(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        From a given node we will extract information and create an Env. This Env is linked to an armor or a weapon.
        Parameters:
        node - Node of the XML file where the armor information start.
        Returns:
        Env
